description.narrative: The Australia-Indonesia partnership Knowledge Sector Initiative is a 15 year program that will strengthen Indonesia's ability to reduce poverty through better policies. Current funding covers the first five years of the program. This initiative will enable planners and decision makers to draw on high quality government-led analysis and policy advice from independent policy institutes. In this first phase (2013-17), the program will work towards an increase in the supply of high quality policy making applied by key policy makers and an avenue for diverse stakeholders to debate policy. The total value of the first phase is $97.4 million over 5 years, starting 2012-13. The first phase is due to finish on 30 June 2017. The second phase will exercise the contractual option to extend into a second five year phase valued at up to $60m for the period 2017-2018 to 2021-22.
